title: Jonathan F . Mack :  Affordability  fixes trade one set of aggrieved for another
description: IN NEW HAMPSHIRE and nationally, the catatonically chanted watchword of the year is “affordability,” essentially a surrogate for the price of housing. Politicians do not know whether to take a, IN NEW HAMPSHIRE and nationally, the catatonically chanted watchword of the year is “affordability,” essentially a surrogate for the price of housing. Politicians do not know whether to take a knee, genuflect, or tap dance when uttering this newly consecrated mantra. Housing, however, is a commodity like no other, and as such, should not drive public policy as if it were just another item in a basket of mundane sundries.
